White settlers felt they had the right to take land from Native Americans simply because they could. At the time of settlers moving to America, Europe were dominating the world with colonies across the globe. The main reason for this European imperialism was Economical. European countries would set up colonies around the world in order to export rare materials such as spices or minerals back to Europe. This was very successful and led to significant economic growth in many of these European empires. However, it also led to numerous rivalries amongst European countries which wasn’t helped by different religious, historical, personal grudges held by influential people. Now all of a sudden there is word of this vast new unclaimed land discovered to the west, with numerous different resources which can be traded back in Europe for a considerable profit. Obviously, all these European countries are gonna try and get there as fast as possible in order to gain an advantage over there rivals. There was only a slight problem in that the indigenous population had already settled with some even open to trade after some initial fighting between early settlers and some native tribes. As time went one they were even sometimes used to assist in the previously mentioned rivalries between European countries. If they happened to be on the losing side of these rivalries they would often also be the ones who lost and suffered the most. However, as more settlers moved over to the America’s they started becoming a nuisance. Wars broke out numerous times between the natives and European settlers, and if there was one thing the Europeans had become very good at over the last couple centuries it was waging war. Europeans felt they had the right to take lands from Native Americans because they were better at waging war. If no one was able to stop them why shouldn’t they simply take all that valuable land. The Native Americans weren’t the first and wouldn’t be the last people who had their land taken from them by European imperialists.
